I've just spending a stupid amount of time rebuilding/re-french polishing my rear cupboards, just so I can mount my Devon mirror back in its correct place above the cooker! - I know, I know I'm turning into a Devon DIC!!

I wondered what the 4 holes in the side trim were for above the cooker, and a post on here last year put me right, its for the mirror mount - since then its been burning away at me that mine is not correct. (help! LOL)

(my one side cupboard was a home built special and too long, so the mirror didn't fit in its correct location!, It seems my Devon only had one rear cupboard for many years - when I stripped the roof table holder, one side had a pale witness mark where the OD cupboard has been for 50 yrs, the other side had aged consistently, Anyhoo at some point a thoughtful PO had quite a good go at scratch building one in Oak, but it was made several inches too long), and as we all know length is very important ;o)

So yesterday I put all the rebuilt cupboards & table holder back in, only to go to fit the final pièce de résistance of the mirror mount and finally put the mirror trimuphantly in place - only to discover the mount I have had for yonks is a repro and the mount/trim holes don't line up anywhere near - gutted I can tell you!

I really don't want to drill yet more holes in my side trims if I can possibly help it... Soooo....

**WANTED** an Original Devon metal mirror mount - it has 'England' stamped on it. (the repros don't and are much narrower, although it does fit the mirror)

ANY hens teeth out there??
Can I prise out of someone's hoarded stash - Good English pounds paid for correct English item! LOL

Here are some pics of my OD door mount - it has England stamped on it, and has radiused inner edges - another needed please!



Here are the 'offending' trim holes, you can see the cupboard is too long, and the mirror has no room (by about an inch!)

Say what you see!

What year is your bus..
Suppliers changed over the years..
I posted pictures of a UK version made by Snail brand in the UK
There is a US version and yours on the door looks to be neither...

Knowledge is a very valuable thing... LOL
I think you will find I have posted extensively on these...
I have one coming from a very kind Forum member and then I think I still require two..

If your mirror is an original mirror look very closely at the wording..Maybe It does not just say England.. Maybe it does! The picture you have posted maybe has misled you...
Yours may have been yet another supplier that Devon used..

You wll then get an idea of what it is you are looking for.
I have three F fittings on my 65 Caravette - only two F fittings on my 64 Caravette (so one F fitting needed there)
I still need two F fittings for my Devonette and that was a cheap version and did not have a mirror but used these F fittings to mount the cooker on the front cupboard!
Found the clue yet?

G

Ooooh! - That link you posted looks much more like the puppy I need....

Not sure about the mottled zinc effect, but beggars can't be choosers!

Thanks for the info Graham!
Are the Caravan Supplies ones not the same dims as OD? (albeit they are modern repros)

The original ones were marked Flushmount = F
So on my 1964 and 1965 buses they are marked Flushmount. The patent has probably expired now so there are lots of items that are now marketted under the name of Flush mount.

You need to measure carefully and buy the same size.
Others do engage but the hole positions as you discovered will be wrong.
If you are seeking to match...then ENGLAND it is.

Flushmount, was fortunate enough to be given a couple of these last year, thread here.
